ca.uwaterloo.softeng.advisor

Class SetSelect

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uwaterloo.softeng.advisor.SetSelect

  •  class SetSelect
extends java.lang.Object
    Constraint satisfaction solver. Store a matrix where columns represent constraints and rows represent items that satisfy constraints. Each element is a either zero for a non-match or non-zero for a match with higher values representing a higher preference for that match. Finds a maximum covering of constraints where an item can satisfy maximum one constraint.

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(int row,
       int col,
       int priority)
        Sets a match with given priority between item in row and constraint in column.
        Parameters:
        row - item row number
        col - constraint column number
        priority - preference for this match

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Choose one element from each row to maximize column coverage. i.e. does one-to-one matching for maximum coverage of columns.

      • firstMaxRow

        private int firstMaxRow(int maxRow,
              int col,
              boolean rowCountOne)
        Finds the first row with the maximum value for that column.
        Parameters:
        column - index of column to search
        maxRow - index of a row with the value to beat
        rowCountOne - if true, rows with counts>1 are ignored
        row - index of first max element

        column - index of first max element
